status.description:
After the blueprint changes to a RUNNING state, open up a terminal and run the following commands:

export VAULT_IP="@@{Vault.address[0]}@@"

curl --request PUT --data "{\
  \\"secret_shares\\": @@{secret_shares}@@,\
  \\"secret_threshold\\": @@{secret_threshold}@@\
}" "http://$VAULT_IP\:8200/v1/sys/init"

Your keys and root token will be returned, which should be saved in a safe place.   Then, from the Application Manage tab, run the "Unseal" action **@@{secret_threshold}@@** times, providing a unique key each time.

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# create the users and set up the directories
sudo useradd -M consul
sudo usermod -L consul
sudo useradd -M vault
sudo usermod -L vault
sudo mkdir /var/consul /var/consul/data /usr/local/etc/consul /etc/vault
sudo chown consul:consul /var/consul /var/consul/data /usr/local/etc/consul

# set up the host variables
hosts=$(echo "@@{ConsulAHV.address}@@" | tr "," "\n")
counter=0
for host in $hosts; do
  declare host${counter}=$host
  counter=$((counter + 1))
done

# create the consul config file
sudo touch /usr/local/etc/consul/client_agent.json
sudo chown centos:centos /usr/local/etc/consul/client_agent.json
cat << EOF > /usr/local/etc/consul/client_agent.json
{
  "server": false,
  "node_name": "consul_c@@{AZ_INT(calm_array_index) + 1}@@",
  "datacenter": "dc1",
  "data_dir": "/var/consul/data",
  "bind_addr": "@@{address}@@",
  "client_addr": "127.0.0.1",
  "retry_join": ["${host0}", "${host1}", "${host2}"],
  "log_level": "DEBUG",
  "enable_syslog": true,
  "acl_enforce_version_8": false
}
EOF
sudo chown consul:consul /usr/local/etc/consul/client_agent.json

# create the vault config file
sudo touch /etc/vault/vault_server.hcl
sudo chown centos:centos /etc/vault/vault_server.hcl
cat << EOF > /etc/vault/vault_server.hcl
ui = @@{ui}@@

listener "tcp" {
  address          = "0.0.0.0:8200"
  cluster_address  = "@@{address}@@:8201"
  tls_disable      = "true"
}

storage "consul" {
  address = "127.0.0.1:8500"
  path    = "vault/"
}

api_addr = "http://@@{address}@@:8200"
cluster_addr = "https://@@{address}@@:8201"
EOF
sudo chown vault:vault /etc/vault/vault_server.hcl

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# create the unit file
echo '### BEGIN INIT INFO
# Provides:          consul
# Required-Start:    $local_fs $remote_fs
# Required-Stop:     $local_fs $remote_fs
# Default-Start:     2 3 4 5
# Default-Stop:      0 1 6
# Short-Description: Consul agent
# Description:       Consul service discovery framework
### END INIT INFO

[Unit]
Description=Consul client agent
Requires=network-online.target
After=network-online.target

[Service]
User=consul
Group=consul
PIDFile=/var/run/consul/consul.pid
PermissionsStartOnly=true
ExecStartPre=-/bin/mkdir -p /var/run/consul
ExecStartPre=/bin/chown -R consul:consul /var/run/consul
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/consul agent \
    -config-file=/usr/local/etc/consul/client_agent.json \
    -pid-file=/var/run/consul/consul.pid
ExecReload=/bin/kill -HUP $MAINPID
KillMode=process
KillSignal=SIGTERM
Restart=on-failure
RestartSec=42s

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target' | sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/consul.service

# reload daemons and start service
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl start consul
sudo systemctl enable consul
sudo systemctl status consul

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

sleep 30

consul members

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# create the unit file
echo '### BEGIN INIT INFO
# Provides:          vault
# Required-Start:    $local_fs $remote_fs
# Required-Stop:     $local_fs $remote_fs
# Default-Start:     2 3 4 5
# Default-Stop:      0 1 6
# Short-Description: Vault server
# Description:       Vault secret management tool
### END INIT INFO

[Unit]
Description=Vault secret management tool
Requires=network-online.target
After=network-online.target

[Service]
User=vault
Group=vault
PIDFile=/var/run/vault/vault.pid
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/vault server -config=/etc/vault/vault_server.hcl -log-level=debug
ExecReload=/bin/kill -HUP $MAINPID
KillMode=process
KillSignal=SIGTERM
Restart=on-failure
RestartSec=42s
LimitMEMLOCK=infinity

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target' | sudo tee /etc/systemd/system/vault.service

# reload daemons and start service
sudo systemctl daemon-reload
sudo systemctl start vault
sudo systemctl enable vault
sudo systemctl status vault

cloud_init.user_data:
#cloud-config
hostname: @@{name}@@
users: 
- name: @@{NUTANIX.username}@@
  shell: /bin/bash
  home: /home/@@{NUTANIX.username}@@
  lock_passwd: true
  sudo: ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL
  ssh-authorized-keys:
    - @@{NUTANIX.public_key}@@
- name: @@{NUTANIX2.username}@@
  shell: /bin/bash
  home: /home/@@{NUTANIX2.username}@@
  lock_passwd: false
  ssh_pwauth: true
  sudo: ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL
  plain_text_passwd: @@{NUTANIX2.secret}@@
write_files:
- path: /etc/cloud/cloud.cfg.d/99-custom-networking.cfg
  permissions: '0644'
  content: |
    network: {config: disabled}
- path: /etc/netplan/01-network-config.yaml
  permissions: '0644'
  content: |
    network:
      version: 2
      ethernets:
        ens3:
          dhcp4: true
runcmd:
- hostnamectl set-hostname  @@{name}@@
- rm /etc/netplan/50-cloud-init.yaml
- netplan generate
- netplan apply
- reboot
final_message: " @@{name}@@ is up after $UPTIME seconds"

attrs.script:
# Set the headers, and url
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}
url     = "http://@@{address}@@:8200/v1/sys/unseal"

# Set the payload
payload = {
  "key": "@@{Key}@@"
}

# Make the request
resp = urlreq(url, verb='PUT', params=json.dumps(payload), headers=headers)

# If the request went through correctly, print it out.  Otherwise error out, and print the response.
if resp.ok:
  print json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4)
else:
  print "Put request failed", resp.content
  exit(1)

# Print a message stating the vault is unsealed
if json.loads(resp.content)['sealed'] == False:
  print "==========================="
  print "Vault successfully unsealed"
  print "==========================="
  exit(0)

# If the vault is still sealed, let the user know the number of keys remaining
else:
  print "========================================"
  print str(json.loads(resp.content)['t']-json.loads(resp.content)['progress']) + " key(s) remaining until vault unsealed."
  print "========================================"
  exit(0)

# Set the headers, and url
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json',
           'X-Vault-Token': '@@{RootToken}@@'}
url     = "http://@@{address}@@:8200/v1/sys/seal"

# Make the request
resp = urlreq(url, verb='PUT', headers=headers)
  
# If the request went through correctly, print it out.  Otherwise error out, and print the response.
if resp.ok:
  print "=========================="
  print "Vault successfully sealed."
  print "=========================="
  exit(0)
else:

sudo mv consul /usr/local/bin/.

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# create the user and set up the directories
sudo useradd -M consul
sudo usermod -L consul
sudo mkdir /var/consul /var/consul/data /usr/local/etc/consul
sudo chown consul:consul /var/consul /var/consul/data /usr/local/etc/consul

# set up the host variables
hosts=$(echo "@@{ConsulAHV.address}@@" | tr "," "\n")
counter=0
for host in $hosts; do
  declare host${counter}=$host
  counter=$((counter + 1))
done

# create the config file
sudo touch /usr/local/etc/consul/server_agent.json
sudo chown centos:centos /usr/local/etc/consul/server_agent.json
cat << EOF > /usr/local/etc/consul/server_agent.json
{
  "server": true,
  "node_name": "consul_s@@{AZ_INT(calm_array_index) + 1}@@",
  "datacenter": "dc1",
  "data_dir": "/var/consul/data",
  "bind_addr": "0.0.0.0",
  "client_addr": "0.0.0.0",
  "advertise_addr": "@@{address}@@",
  "bootstrap_expect": 3,
  "retry_join": ["${host0}", "${host1}", "${host2}"],
  "ui": true,
  "log_level": "DEBUG",
  "enable_syslog": true,
  "acl_enforce_version_8": false
}
EOF
sudo chown consul:consul /usr/local/etc/consul/server_agent.json

spec.description:
After the blueprint changes to a RUNNING state, open up a terminal and run the following commands:

export VAULT_IP="@@{Vault.address[0]}@@"

curl --request PUT --data "{\
  \\"secret_shares\\": @@{secret_shares}@@,\
  \\"secret_threshold\\": @@{secret_threshold}@@\
}" "http://$VAULT_IP\:8200/v1/sys/init"

Your keys and root token will be returned, which should be saved in a safe place.   Then, from the Application Manage tab, run the "Unseal" action **@@{secret_threshold}@@** times, providing a unique key each time.

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# create the users and set up the directories
sudo useradd -M consul
sudo usermod -L consul
sudo useradd -M vault
sudo usermod -L vault
sudo mkdir /var/consul /var/consul/data /usr/local/etc/consul /etc/vault
sudo chown consul:consul /var/consul /var/consul/data /usr/local/etc/consul

# set up the host variables
hosts=$(echo "@@{ConsulAHV.address}@@" | tr "," "\n")
counter=0
for host in $hosts; do
  declare host${counter}=$host
  counter=$((counter + 1))
done

# create the consul config file
sudo touch /usr/local/etc/consul/client_agent.json
sudo chown centos:centos /usr/local/etc/consul/client_agent.json
cat << EOF > /usr/local/etc/consul/client_agent.json
{
  "server": false,
  "node_name": "consul_c@@{AZ_INT(calm_array_index) + 1}@@",
  "datacenter": "dc1",
  "data_dir": "/var/consul/data",
  "bind_addr": "@@{address}@@",
  "client_addr": "127.0.0.1",
  "retry_join": ["${host0}", "${host1}", "${host2}"],
  "log_level": "DEBUG",
  "enable_syslog": true,
  "acl_enforce_version_8": false
}
EOF
sudo chown consul:consul /usr/local/etc/consul/client_agent.json

# create the vault config file
sudo touch /etc/vault/vault_server.hcl
sudo chown centos:centos /etc/vault/vault_server.hcl
cat << EOF > /etc/vault/vault_server.hcl
ui = @@{ui}@@

listener "tcp" {
  address          = "0.0.0.0:8200"
  cluster_address  = "@@{address}@@:8201"
  tls_disable      = "true"
}

storage "consul" {
  address = "127.0.0.1:8500"
  path    = "vault/"
}

api_addr = "http://@@{address}@@:8200"
cluster_addr = "https://@@{address}@@:8201"
EOF
sudo chown vault:vault /etc/vault/vault_server.hcl

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

# yum update and package installation
sudo yum update -y
sudo yum install -y unzip wget

# get the consul and vault binaries and put them in the proper locations
wget https://releases.hashicorp.com/consul/1.4.1/consul_1.4.1_linux_amd64.zip
wget https://releases.hashicorp.com/vault/1.0.2/vault_1.0.2_linux_amd64.zip
unzip consul_1.4.1_linux_amd64.zip
unzip vault_1.0.2_linux_amd64.zip
rm consul_1.4.1_linux_amd64.zip vault_1.0.2_linux_amd64.zip
sudo mv consul vault /usr/local/bin/.
sudo chown root:root /usr/local/bin/consul /usr/local/bin/vault
sudo chcon -u system_u -t bin_t /usr/local/bin/consul /usr/local/bin/vault

# Set the headers, and url
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json'}
url     = "http://@@{address}@@:8200/v1/sys/unseal"

# Set the payload
payload = {
  "key": "@@{Key}@@"
}

# Make the request
resp = urlreq(url, verb='PUT', params=json.dumps(payload), headers=headers)

# If the request went through correctly, print it out.  Otherwise error out, and print the response.
if resp.ok:
  print json.dumps(json.loads(resp.content), indent=4)
else:
  print "Put request failed", resp.content
  exit(1)

# Print a message stating the vault is unsealed
if json.loads(resp.content)['sealed'] == False:
  print "==========================="
  print "Vault successfully unsealed"
  print "==========================="
  exit(0)

# If the vault is still sealed, let the user know the number of keys remaining
else:
  print "========================================"
  print str(json.loads(resp.content)['t']-json.loads(resp.content)['progress']) + " key(s) remaining until vault unsealed."
  print "========================================"
  exit(0)

# Set the headers, and url
headers = {'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Accept': 'application/json',
           'X-Vault-Token': '@@{RootToken}@@'}
url     = "http://@@{address}@@:8200/v1/sys/seal"

# Make the request
resp = urlreq(url, verb='PUT', headers=headers)
  
# If the request went through correctly, print it out.  Otherwise error out, and print the response.
if resp.ok:
  print "=========================="
  print "Vault successfully sealed."
  print "=========================="
  exit(0)
else:
  print "Put request failed", resp.content
  exit(1)
